name: radio-invented
description: Guglielmo Marconi demonstrated wireless telegraphy, paving the way for radio broadcasting.

name: satellite-navigation-system
description: The U.S. Navy launched Transit, the first satellite navigation system, a precursor to GPS.

name: first-smartphone
description: IBM Simon, the first smartphone with a touchscreen, went on sale to consumers.

name: 3d-printer-invented
description: Chuck Hull invented stereolithography, the first 3D printing technology for creating solid objects.

name: first-computer-eniac
description: ENIAC, the first general-purpose electronic computer, was unveiled at the University of Pennsylvania.

name: nuclear-bomb-tested
description: The Trinity test in New Mexico detonated the first nuclear weapon, ushering in the atomic age.

name: crispr-first-human-use
description: CRISPR gene-editing therapy was first used to treat sickle cell disease in patients.

name: first-blood-transfusion
description: French physician Jean-Baptiste Denys performed the first documented blood transfusion on a human.

name: bifocal-glasses-invented
description: Benjamin Franklin invented bifocal eyeglasses, combining distance and reading lenses.

name: nintendo-entertainment-system
description: Nintendo released the NES in North America, reviving the home video game industry.

name: playstation-released
description: Sony released the PlayStation in Japan, establishing a dominant console gaming brand.

name: windows-95-released
description: Microsoft launched Windows 95, bringing the graphical desktop interface to the masses.

name: netflix-streaming-begins
description: Netflix launched its streaming service, beginning the shift from physical media to digital.

name: uber-founded
description: Uber was founded in San Francisco, pioneering the ride-sharing gig economy.

name: openai-gpt-released
description: OpenAI released GPT, a transformer-based language model that advanced AI text generation.

name: tiktok-launched-global
description: TikTok merged with Musical.ly and launched globally, becoming a dominant short-video platform.

name: cleopatra-rules-egypt
description: Cleopatra VII became co-ruler of Egypt, the last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom.

name: terracotta-warriors-found
description: Farmers in Xi'an, China accidentally discovered thousands of life-sized terracotta warriors.

name: otzi-iceman-found
description: Hikers discovered a 5,300-year-old mummified man preserved in an Alpine glacier.

name: neanderthal-bones-found
description: Workers in Germany's Neander Valley found bones of an ancient human species.

name: first-transatlantic-flight
description: Alcock and Brown completed the first nonstop transatlantic flight from Newfoundland to Ireland.

name: cuban-missile-crisis
description: A 13-day standoff between the US and Soviet Union brought the world to the brink of nuclear war.

name: petra-carved
description: The Nabataeans carved the Treasury at Petra into sandstone cliffs in modern-day Jordan.

name: first-world-cup
description: Uruguay hosted and won the first FIFA World Cup football tournament.

name: first-super-bowl
description: The Green Bay Packers won the first AFL-NFL Championship Game, later called the Super Bowl.

name: moonlight-sonata-composed
description: Beethoven composed his Piano Sonata No. 14, nicknamed the 'Moonlight Sonata.'

name: romeo-juliet-written
description: Shakespeare published Romeo and Juliet, one of the most enduring love stories ever written.

name: spanish-inquisition
description: Ferdinand and Isabella established the Spanish Inquisition to enforce Catholic orthodoxy.

name: first-photograph-color
description: James Clerk Maxwell produced the first color photograph using three color-filtered images.

name: morse-code-first-message
description: Samuel Morse sent 'What hath God wrought' via telegraph from Washington to Baltimore.

name: discovery-penicillin
description: Alexander Fleming noticed mold killing bacteria in his lab, discovering the first antibiotic.

name: rosetta-stone-decoded
description: Jean-François Champollion deciphered Egyptian hieroglyphics using the Rosetta Stone.

name: first-flight-concorde
description: The Concorde supersonic airliner made its maiden flight, flying passengers at twice the speed of sound.

name: gutenberg-movable-type
description: Johannes Gutenberg developed the movable type printing press, revolutionizing the spread of knowledge.

name: suez-crisis
description: Britain, France, and Israel invaded Egypt over the Suez Canal, leading to international condemnation.

name: first-human-heart-transplant
description: Dr. Christiaan Barnard performed the first human heart transplant in Cape Town, South Africa.

name: prohibition-begins-us
description: The 18th Amendment took effect, banning alcohol sales in the United States.

name: prohibition-ends-us
description: The 21st Amendment repealed Prohibition, ending 13 years of a nationwide alcohol ban.

name: first-electric-car
description: Thomas Parker built one of the first practical electric cars in Wolverhampton, England.

name: peloponnesian-war-ends
description: Sparta defeated Athens, ending the 27-year Peloponnesian War and Athenian dominance in Greece.

name: boston-tea-party-event
description: American colonists dumped tea into Boston Harbor to protest British taxation without representation.

name: creation-of-internet
description: ARPANET adopted TCP/IP, the protocol that became the foundation of the modern internet.

name: first-electric-guitar
description: George Beauchamp and Adolph Rickenbacker created the first commercially viable electric guitar.

name: xerox-alto-computer
description: Xerox PARC developed the Alto, the first computer with a graphical user interface and mouse.

name: apple-macintosh-released
description: Apple released the Macintosh, popularizing the graphical user interface for personal computers.

name: first-text-message-sent
description: Neil Papworth sent the first SMS text message, reading 'Merry Christmas,' to a Vodafone phone.

name: wikipedia-created
description: Jimmy Wales and Larry Sanger launched Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia anyone can edit.

name: silk-road-established
description: The Han Dynasty established trade connections westward, creating the legendary Silk Road network.

name: voyager-2-neptune-flyby
description: Voyager 2 completed the first and only flyby of Neptune, revealing its Great Dark Spot.

name: pompeii-rediscovered
description: Spanish engineer Rocque Joaquin de Alcubierre rediscovered the buried Roman city of Pompeii.

name: microwave-background-discovered
description: Penzias and Wilson accidentally discovered cosmic background radiation, confirming the Big Bang theory.

name: first-antibiotic-sulfa
description: Gerhard Domagk demonstrated Prontosil, the first commercially available antibacterial drug.

name: compact-disc-released
description: Sony and Philips released the first commercial compact disc, Billy Joel's '52nd Street.'

name: mp3-format-created
description: The Fraunhofer Institute released the MP3 audio format, enabling digital music distribution.

name: first-email-spam
description: Gary Thuerk sent the first unsolicited mass email to 400 ARPANET users promoting DEC computers.

name: first-atm-machine
description: Barclays Bank in London installed the world's first automated teller machine.

name: great-exhibition-1851
description: The first World's Fair opened in London's Crystal Palace, showcasing industrial innovation.

name: fall-of-aztec-empire
description: Hernán Cortés and his allies conquered Tenochtitlan, ending the Aztec Empire.

name: fall-of-inca-empire
description: Francisco Pizarro executed Inca emperor Atahualpa, bringing the Inca Empire under Spanish control.

name: scramble-for-africa
description: European powers carved up Africa at the Berlin Conference, beginning the 'Scramble for Africa.'

name: atomic-clock-invented
description: NIST built the first atomic clock, using ammonia molecules for unprecedented timekeeping accuracy.

name: solar-panel-invented
description: Bell Labs created the first practical silicon solar cell, converting sunlight into electricity.

name: richter-scale-invented
description: Charles Richter developed the magnitude scale for measuring earthquake strength.

name: first-antiretroviral-hiv
description: AZT became the first FDA-approved drug to treat HIV/AIDS, extending patients' lives.

name: insulin-pump-invented
description: Dean Kamen developed the first wearable insulin pump for continuous diabetes management.

name: first-3g-network
description: NTT DoCoMo launched the first 3G mobile network in Japan, enabling mobile internet.

name: kindle-launched
description: Amazon released the Kindle e-reader, accelerating the shift to digital books.

name: airbnb-founded
description: Brian Chesky and Joe Gebbia launched Airbnb, disrupting the hospitality industry with home sharing.

name: panama-papers-leaked
description: A massive leak of financial documents exposed offshore tax havens used by world leaders and celebrities.

name: mongol-empire-peak
description: Under Kublai Khan, the Mongol Empire reached its greatest extent, the largest contiguous land empire.

name: printing-korea-jikji
description: Korean monks printed the Jikji, the oldest known book printed with movable metal type.

name: vaccination-rinderpest-eradicated
description: Rinderpest became the second disease (after smallpox) to be eradicated through vaccination.

name: panama-canal-expansion
description: A $5.25 billion expansion doubled the Panama Canal's capacity with new, larger locks.

name: three-gorges-dam-completed
description: China completed the Three Gorges Dam, the world's largest hydroelectric power station.

name: space-shuttle-first-launch
description: Columbia became the first space shuttle to reach orbit, beginning the reusable spacecraft era.

name: dolly-the-sheep-born
description: Scientists in Scotland cloned Dolly the sheep, the first mammal cloned from an adult cell.

name: large-hadron-collider-first-beam
description: CERN activated the Large Hadron Collider, the world's most powerful particle accelerator.

name: penicillin-discovered-fleming
description: Alexander Fleming noticed mold killing bacteria in his lab, discovering the first antibiotic.

name: krakatoa-erupts-1883
description: Krakatoa's eruption killed over 36,000 people and produced the loudest sound in recorded history.

name: tunguska-event
description: A massive explosion over Siberia flattened 80 million trees, likely caused by an asteroid airburst.

name: lake-nyos-disaster-1986
description: A lake in Cameroon released a cloud of CO2 that suffocated nearly 1,800 people overnight.

name: antioch-earthquake-115
description: A massive earthquake struck Antioch while Emperor Trajan was visiting, killing an estimated 260,000.

name: great-molasses-flood
description: A storage tank burst in Boston, sending a wave of 2.3 million gallons of molasses through the streets.

name: dreyfus-affair
description: French officer Alfred Dreyfus was falsely convicted of treason, sparking a national scandal over antisemitism.

name: scopes-monkey-trial
description: A Tennessee teacher was tried for teaching evolution, in a landmark debate over science and religion.

name: rosie-the-riveter
description: The 'We Can Do It!' poster became a symbol of women entering the workforce during World War II.

name: first-ted-talk
description: The first TED conference was held in Monterey, California, focusing on technology, entertainment, and design.

name: spotify-launched
description: Spotify launched in Sweden, pioneering legal music streaming and reshaping the music industry.

name: treaty-of-westphalia
description: The peace treaty ended the Thirty Years' War and established the modern concept of state sovereignty.

name: bill-of-rights-ratified
description: The first ten amendments to the US Constitution were ratified, guaranteeing fundamental freedoms.

name: meiji-restoration
description: Japan ended centuries of feudal shogunate rule and rapidly modernized under Emperor Meiji.

name: league-of-nations-formed
description: The first international organization for world peace was established after World War I.

name: iron-curtain-speech
description: Winston Churchill's speech in Missouri warned of Soviet domination of Eastern Europe.

name: decolonization-africa-year
description: Seventeen African nations gained independence in a single year, reshaping the global political map.

name: hong-kong-handover
description: Britain returned sovereignty of Hong Kong to China after 156 years of colonial rule.

name: acropolis-construction
description: Pericles began rebuilding the Acropolis, including the Parthenon, as a symbol of Athenian power.

name: catacombs-paris
description: Paris began transferring remains to underground tunnels, creating the famous Catacombs.

name: first-skyscraper-elevator
description: Elisha Otis publicly demonstrated his safety elevator, making tall buildings practical.

name: assembly-line-ford
description: Henry Ford introduced the moving assembly line, cutting Model T production time from 12 hours to 93 minutes.
